title.value: Bird Distribution Modelling Using Sensing and Citizen Science Data
title.justification: This is the explicit title provided in the paper.
title.quote: BIRD DISTRIBUTION MODELLING USING SENSING AND CITIZEN SCIENCE DATA

extractions.description: The paper focuses on leveraging computer vision and remote sensing combined with citizen science data to model species distribution, specifically focusing on bird species in the continental USA. It introduces a novel dataset and task for predicting bird species encounter rates from satellite images and establishes baseline models to demonstrate the efficacy of the approach.

type.justification: The paper involves the creation of a dataset, establishment of baseline models, and conducts experiments to evaluate the efficacy of these models.
type.quote: We introduce a novel task and dataset for mapping US bird species to their habitats by predicting species encounter rates from satellite images, along with baseline models which demonstrate the power of our approach.

name.justification: The study focuses on leveraging remote sensing data (satellite images) and computer vision techniques to predict bird species distributions.
name.quote: We propose an approach leveraging computer vision to improve species distribution modelling, combining the wide availability of remote sensing data with sparse on-ground citizen science data.

name.justification: A significant aspect of the paper is understanding and monitoring the changing distributions of bird species as a result of climate change.
name.quote: Climate change is a major driver of biodiversity loss, changing the geographic range and abundance of many species.

name.justification: The paper explicitly focuses on species distribution modelling (SDMs) using remote sensing and citizen science data.
name.quote: We propose to use remote sensing to infer the joint distribution of many species for a given location, using publicly available citizen science observation records as ground truth.

name.justification: The authors use a CNN model with ResNet-18 architecture in their experiments.
name.quote: We propose a first CNN model with ResNet-18 (He et al., 2016) architecture.

is_contributed.justification: ResNet-18 is an established model in the field of computer vision and was not developed by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: We propose a first CNN model with ResNet-18 (He et al., 2016) architecture.

is_executed.justification: The ResNet-18 model was trained and tested as part of the experiments conducted in the study.
is_executed.quote: We propose a first CNN model with ResNet-18 (He et al., 2016) architecture. We initialize the network with ImageNet pretrained weights.

is_compared.justification: The performance of the ResNet-18 based model is compared against other baseline models within the study.
is_compared.quote: While the CNN baseline with RGB and NIR bands does not outperform the environmental baseline on all metrics, combining satellite and environmental data outperforms the latter, particularly on the top-k metric.
